page.title: 07WILDLIFE SEEN AT SKELBRAE
page.content: At{Skelbrae}Mrs.Allan finds about{10 {birds' nests each year}in the barns & walls. Most of them are{starlings}& {sparrows.}The most common birds she sees are gulls, mainly{Herring gulls, {Common gulls}and{Black-headed gulls. Her son, Michael, collects{bird rings. {He gives them to Mr.Thorne,}the headmaster, who sends them to the{ {Natural History Museum.}Mrs.Allan also sees many{wild mammals}like rabbits, voles and mice. Sanday folk use{local {names}for wild-life, for example:{Teeo {(Lapwing); Chaldro}(Oyster Catcher); Skarf (Shag);{Tammy Norie}(Puffin); Horse-Gock (Snipe);{Dunter}(Eider Duck);{Moosie-Hak}(Kestrel);{Whaup {(Curlew); Mallimak}(Fulmar);{Skorie {(Seagull);}&{Selkie}(Seal). Mrs.Allan collects{Spoots}(razor shells), but does not go to the{Tangles}(seaweed gathering).
